AD_NightsongAttacked.synopsis: Nightsong cries in pain as she gets attacked by the player.

AD_TauntPlayer.synopsis: Nightsong tries to goad the player into killing her
AD_TauntPlayer.how_to_trigger: Enter combat with Nightsong in the Shadowfell

CINE_NightsongsDeath.synopsis: After killing Nightsong the player sees the aftermath in Last Light
CINE_NightsongsDeath.how_to_trigger: Kill Nightsong as part of Shadowheart's OM

CINE_NightsongsFlight.synopsis: After the player frees Nightsong we see her fly towards Moonrise to confront Ketheric. She passes over Last Light, where Isobel or Jaheira observe her flight from a window.
CINE_NightsongsFlight.how_to_trigger: Free Nightsong from the soul cage in the Shadowfell

AD_NightsongAttacked_0.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongAttacked_0.text: Unleash your wrath! It only fuels my fury.

AD_NightsongAttacked_3.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongAttacked_3.text: I've known worse pain than this. Far worse.

AD_TauntPlayer_0.speaker: Nightsong
AD_TauntPlayer_0.text: What are you afraid of? Your own wicked heart?

AD_TauntPlayer_1.speaker: Nightsong
AD_TauntPlayer_1.text: Where are your guts? Your brawn?

AD_TauntPlayer_2.speaker: Nightsong
AD_TauntPlayer_2.text: Strike me down, if you dare.

AD_TauntPlayer_3.speaker: Nightsong
AD_TauntPlayer_3.text: Go on, toy soldier. Run me through!

CINE_NightsongsDeath_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: 'The permiter of torches surrounding the inn flicker and go out, all at once. Shadowy figures start to move in between, descending on the inn'

CINE_NightsongsDeath_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stunned, lit only by candlelight, she strains to see out the window - then flinches as screams echo inside the inn. She turns to the door as the sound of combat grows closer. She's already reaching for a weapon when the candles go out - and in darkness we hear her door crashing open. Wide shot from the far side of Last Light's bridge: all sources of light flicker and die as the darkness closes in. The screaming goes on.

CINE_NightsongsDeath_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel stands at a window in Last Light, dawning horror as the light of the dome begins to fail. Isobel holds her hand up, straining to maintain the barrier - then staggers as it goes out entirely.

CINE_NightsongsDeath_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira stands at a window in Last Light, eyes drawn to the perimeter of torches around the inn. With dawning horror, she watches them flicker and go out, all at once. Shadowy figures move in between.

CINE_NightsongsFlight_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide shot of a figure arcing up into sky high above the temple, trailing pure white light. Close-up as Nightsong surveys the shadow-lands, the light intensifying around her as her rage builds. She swoops down, light spreading in her wake as she gathers speed. CU on an overgrown ruin in SCL. Where Nightsong passes, colour and contrast leak back in as the shadows part.

CINE_NightsongsFlight_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong drifts slowly over the remains of Last Light, her spreading light revealing the recent destruction. (Focus on scenery and signs of battle over NPCs). CU on Nightsong - her face darkens. She turns to face Moonrise Towers, the last glimmer of light in the land. Nightsong leans forward and streaks towards Moonrise, gathering speed all the time.

CINE_NightsongsFlight_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Isobel at a window in Last Light, a glow touching her face as she looks up in wonder.
Shot from her POV: Nightsong like a shooting star, opening up a path of light as she streaks towards Moonrise.

CINE_NightsongsFlight_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira at a window in Last Light, a glow touching her face as she looks up in wonder. Shot from Jaheira's POV: Nightsong like a shooting star, opening up a path of light as she streaks towards Moonrise. Smiling fiercely, Jaheira turns from the window and crosses to a table where her sword waits.
